meanings.sent1: She tends to misdivide the pizza slices, making them uneven.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misdivide the candies among the children, make sure each gets an equal share.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, he managed to misdivide the puzzle pieces, creating a funny-looking picture.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to misdivide the responsibilities at work ended up causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The chef's decision to misdivide the ingredients resulted in a disastrous dish.

meanings.definition: To separate into parts or sections in a mistaken or faulty manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher accidentally misdivided the students into the wrong groups for the project.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to misdivide the documents if you are not paying attention to the details.
meanings.sent3: Trying to misdivide the colors of the rainbow, he ended up creating a new imaginary color.
meanings.sent4: The artist's attempt to misdivide the canvas into unequal sections added an interesting twist to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's decision to misdivide the flowerbeds resulted in a beautiful, yet unconventional garden design.
